newsitem.title: USA: Daschle sees possible movement on US budget accord.
newsitem.headline: Daschle sees possible movement on US budget accord.

text.p: Senate Democratic Leader Tom Daschle said on Thursday he was encouraged by apparent movement towards an accord on the federal budget.
"With the reports I've been getting in the last couple of days, there appears to be movement," Daschle told reporters.

Daschle added: "I don't want to characterize the movement except to say that I think that there appears to be an interest and willingness on both sides to see if we might find common ground and agreement. And that's encouraging..."
Democratic leaders and Democrats involved in the budget process will meet President Clinton at the White House Thursday morning to discuss the budget.
Daschle said he hoped the meeting would clarify priorities and he was "increasingly optimistic" that someting could be done.
